Comment: Seriously, come out and say, hey we are going to do some spying on another country. What is the point of spying if you are going to tell the country you are going to do it?
Author: ComputerRedneck

Comment: I'm waiting for anyone or anything to show persuasive reasons why Canadagate/Greenlandgate is more than the occasional chuckle in the WH promoted to *policy-level drama* by having multiple articles written about each chuckle.  Trump can just namedrop 'Canada' in a conversation that is 99.9999% about Europe/Africa/Asia (and our relations with them,) and then the media will write a thousand articles about Canada. The way the media handles it is like an older kind of AI response that doesn't intricately process data tokens, it just flips from message to message like the quest characters from Super Nintendo games.  If we really wanted Canada badly enough we'd stop saying "guard the border."
Author: D_Ethan_Bones

Comment: I'm telling you right now we already know everything we need to know about Greenland. This feels like one of those leaks to catch the mole.
